definitions.definition: to take and keep something in your hand or arms:
examples: Can you hold the bag while I open the door?
Will the rope be strong enough to hold my weight?

definitions.definition: to press your nose tightly between thumb and finger in order to close it:
examples: I have to hold my nose when I jump into water.

definitions.definition: When two people hold hands, one person holds the other person's hand, especially to show that they love each other:
the act of holding something or someone, or the way you do this:
examples: Keep a tight hold on your tickets.

definitions.definition: to start holding something or someone:
examples: He took hold of one end of the carpet and tugged.

definitions.definition: in fighting sports, a position in which one person holds another person so that they cannot move
a place to put the hands and feet, especially when climbing
